Description: In recent years, significant advances have been made in understanding the subsets and functional states of conventional dendritic cells in cancer. As such, considerable attention has turned to the application of these findings to immunotherapy. Dendritic cell-based vaccination strategies as well as conventional dendritic cell modulating compounds are a quickly evolving field within cancer therapy. In this session, we will highlight new discoveries in the field of dendritic cell biology and anti-tumor immunity and discuss their implications for cancer immunotherapy.
Location: Ballroom 6 B - Upper Level - Convention Center
